intro: Erigeron leptophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron leptophyllus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments with minimal water availability.
